text: I think you need to use the `IN` operator rather than `EQ` . The difference is that the former works with `values` whereas the latter expects just one `value`.
Are you getting an error when authenticating with those scopes, or does it happen when accessing specific endpoints?

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Localized-label/m-p/736962|This post> isn’t 100% clear to me, but it seems to indicate that getting localised labels is not possible. The bit that isn’t clear is that the second paragraph says it _is_ possible if you pass a `locale` parameter. Unfortunately there aren’t any details or links to supporting documentation.

Did you try moving it to it's own custom code action? As long as the action executes in 20 seconds or less you shouldn't get that error

Yes, unfortunately: there are a lot of types of problems with requests which don’t have specific error messages. I recommend removing parts of your JSON query until you find the thing that’s breaking it.
oh I forgot to say this _was_ working all the way until this morning
So nothing about your requests has changed?
nope
That is frustrating. I would still recommend the above approach to see if you can isolate the problem.
This is an issue on HubSpot’s end, status page update is coming shortly. We’ve already added copy to our UI if you want to take a peak in app
